Konner Macias

About:

I’m a fourth year Mathematics of Computation major and Statistics minor at UCLA, aiming to become a software engineer. I’m from the Sacramento Area and have grown up with sports my whole life. I mainly played junior competitive tennis and even received some DII college offers, but I couldn't turn down studying here! Formally the President of this club and the Team Captain of UCLA's competitive club tennis club, I have stepped down from the head roles to focus on my studies and the job search. My main sports of interest are tennis and basketball, though I'm a fan of all. Looking forward to a great year of sports research!

Feel free to reach out at konnermacias@ucla.edu.

Articles:

BSA Exclusive: Our Journey Through Research

03 Jun 2018 • 13 min read

With this article, we hope to detail our process as members of Bruin Sports Analytics to work towards getting a well-done research paper completed, with guidance given by our club advisor, Professor Almohalwas of the UCLA Statistics department. We wish to detail our journey, and all the lessons we have taken from each one to move us closer to completing our desired task. In hopes of creating a paper worthy of being published in an official sports analytics journal, we have decided to take more time in working towards our final result. However, we have decided to write this extended article to provide a checkpoint of where currently stand in hopes for others to get inspired to do research as an undergrad, and learn more about the interesting attempts we have tried to solve our problem.

Think Twice Against ESPN Fantasy Projections

19 Sep 2017 • 2 min read

With the second week of the NFL concluding last night with a 24–10 victory for the Lions over the Giants, I decided to take a look at ESPN fantasy point projection accuracy thus far. ESPN is one of the leading hosts for fantasy football leagues around the country with millions of people trusting their projections to decide which players they should start. After comparing the starting point projections for each week against the actual number of points the player earned, it looks like ESPN has to step up their game.

The Kershaw-less Dodgers: A Not So Dark Time…

29 Aug 2017 • 2 min read

As the Los Angeles Dodgers end the month of August, they are still the heavy favorite to win the World Series. Since July 23rd, 2017, Clayton Kershaw has not played one game for the Dodgers. Many fans thought the absence of their star pitcher would be devastating to their pace to break the MLB record for best win percentage. While his back injury should of been disastrous, it appears at though the Dodgers are doing just fine without Clayton.
